The view from my room was spectacular and I loved sitting on the chaiselonge especially at night and just looking out of the window. I left the curtains open so I was woken by the sun rising from behind the mountains and glittering on the water of the Lake Xuanwu.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My recent stay at the Intercontinental was decent but not spectacular. The hotel had some rough around the edges qualities that didn't really detract from my stay but make me hesitant to recommend the hotel. The room itself was very comfortable and clean. The price was not too exorbitant. Our room rate included breakfast which was an above average hotel breakfast buffet. We traveled for tourism and found the hotel well located. We walked to a few different restaurants in the area and it was also convenient to the Nanjing metro which made seeing the city a breeze. Unfortunately, the hotel had a few less than positive aspects. One night we headed to the 78th floor bar but it was overwhelmed with cigar smoke. No problem, there is another bar area on the 45th floor. It was amateur hour down there. We ordered two drinks, a manhattan and a mai tai. These drinks are not rocket science but it took two bartenders, the print out of the recipe, and my wife speaking some Chinese to get the mai tai right. If the staff can't be trained to make simple cocktails they shouldn't be on the menu at more than $10US per drink. Lastly, if I stay at the Intercontinental it's not because I am trying to save money but the prices to use the internet were just laughable. $10US for a half an hour and aprox $30US for 2hrs of service. Looking on the bright side, I guess it was nice to check email for a weekend. If I have occasion to head back to Nanjing, I think I'll try the Westin.
reviews.title: Bland Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the center of Nanjing. It is the tallest building in the city, thereby giving you an amazing view from your room. The hotel is modern, luxurious, and clean, and the staff was very helpful, had a good English vocabulary, and was highly welcoming. Free WIFI and breakfast, which was one of the best hotel breakfasts I ever had. The food was fresh and they had a large variety of different food (Chinese, American, European). The room was very spacious, and the bathroom was fantastic with separate toilet, shower and bathtub.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: No doubt that I will stay here the next time I´m in Nanjing!
reviews.title: Wow! What an experience

reviews.text: I have stayed in HI Aqua city and the Crown Plaza before. They are both very nice however, staying at the InterContinental Nanjing was an experience. Open for about a year, this is the tallest structure in the city I believe. The room was big wjth a giant bath tub in the center. After a long flight from USA to HKG and then Nanjing, this was the perfect way to pamper myself. The breakfast buffet was thorough and quite good, with both Western and asian stations available. The InterCon club was nice and relaxing with a nice selection of teas and coffees. If I had one complaint , it would be that the gym was somewhat underwhelming.
reviews.title: Good but must be better

reviews.text: The hotel is located at a convenient place.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the enormous tower in Nanjing and provides outstanding views. The rooms themselves are a very nice size and very comfortable, especially for the reasonable price. Breakfast buffet was very good. The main bar is a bit disappointing as it's way too smokey and loud; a simple air purifier can go a long way.
reviews.title: Good value, nice location

reviews.text: The hotel is also within walking distance of Xuanwu lake and Jiming Temple, which are highlights of Nanjing.
reviews.title: Could not be better!

reviews.text: I had a wonderful stay in this Hotel. The Service was outstanding and the room great. I had a Suite in the 62th floor what was absolute great. I had to say that this is one of the best IC´s I ever stayed worldwide and I know some. That is the reason to give this comment. Looking forward to be there again!
reviews.title: Undecided

reviews.text: This was my second visit to this hotel both times on business and both times i have had a mixed view of the hotel. I hold Royal Ambassador status with the Intercontinental brand and stay almost 80% of my time away in Intercon hotels so I am familiar with the level of service that is expected when you stay at one of their hotels. For some reason it is a very mixed bag at this hotel - some staff are brilliant ( Rock in Prime is outstanding as was Davis (?) one of the bellboys) but others are indifferent or in one case just plain rude. Very frustrating! I would have put it down to a bad couple of days but both times I experienced it so I suspect it is a training issue.
reviews.title: Simply Superb

reviews.text: the hotel itself is lovely and the rooms generally are fantastic although I reserve opinion on the one with the tub in the middle of the room as a colleague commented you felt as though you were in a porn movie! The rooms were very clean and extremely comfortable and the views outstanding. The restaurants again were a mixed bag with Prime being very good although somewhat pricey and the Horizon cafe somewhat average ( cold steak in my case and when it was sent back a surly attitude and an overcooked steak on return!). The club lounge is large but really under utilised and the breakfast and drinks are not very good. Check in was a bit messy when a change of room was necessary but it was finally dealt with after 45mins! Check out was smooth and gracious.
reviews.title: "Home" away from"Home"
